About me

As part of my bachelor's degree in computational linguistics, I learned programming from the very beginning with a strong scientific focus. Machine learning and AI in the context of natural language processing were particularly important topics during my bachelor's degree. In addition to my studies, I also worked as a tutor at the university and also designed and taught courses on STEM topics for schools.
In 2020, I began my Master's degree in Audio Communication and Technology. Through various part-time jobs during my studies, I learned to apply theoretical computer science knowledge and write efficient code. After an extended stay abroad in Denmark, I began teaching programming courses as part of programs for women's empowerment. Since then, I have introduced computer science to various target groups at schools, universities, and training institutes.

I have been working freelance in the field of IT since 2024 and value the combination of technical work and knowledge transfer.

CV

  • Today - Freelance Computer Scientist

  • since 2024 - Lecturer for Computer Science at IBB Institut für berufliche Bildung AG

  • 2024 - Master of Science: Audiocommunication and -technology

  • 2024 - Teacher for Web-Development at Devhaus Leipzig GmbH

  • since 2023 - Guest lecturer for Python at Uni Bremen

  • since 2022 - Guest lecturer for Python at TU Berlin

  • since 2022 - Teacher for the Robotics Club at BIP Kreativitätsschule Leipzig

  • 2021 - 2022 - student worker at Fachhochschule Kiel GmbH

  • 2016 - 2020 - Bachelor of Science: Computational Linguistics

  • 2018 - 2020 - STEM-tutor at Uni Potsdam

  • 2018 - Semester abroad at University of Minnesota, USA

  • 2017 - 2019 - student worker at Uni Potsdam

  • since 2008 - occasional work as an actress
